context: A security incident was observed starting with a file dropped and launched from a remote location on host `vnevado-win10b`. It involved the execution of the file `psexesvc.exe` by account `fk8mq` with ProcessID `5512`. This could indicate an attacker or malware attempting lateral movement or propagation. Later, an alert was triggered indicating a suspected overpass-the-hash attack (Kerberos) attempted by Emma Clark (Helpdesk Administrator) on VNEVADO-Win10V against VNEVADO-DC.
question: In the subsequent alert, a user was involved in enumerating SMB sessions on VNEVADO-DC and retrieving recent IP addresses of 2 accounts. Can you identify the name of this user?
solution_steps: An account with Sid `S-1-5-21-1540151660-3530000288-105586595-1517` was used in a remote session to drop and execute a file, potentially by an attacker or malware attempting lateral movement.
Emma Clark (Helpdesk Administrator) on host `VNEVADO-Win10V` attempted to authenticate against `VNEVADO-DC`, suspected to be an overpass-the-hash attack involving Kerberos.
Ethan Brooks (Account Executive) on host `VNEVADO-Win10V` performed SMB reconnaissance to enumerate SMB sessions on `VNEVADO-DC` and retrieved recent IP addresses of 2 accounts.
